The impact of the war has dramatically changed Ukraine's economic outlook. Last week our Executive Board approved $1.4 billion in emergency funding for #Ukraine to help meet urgent financing needs and mitigate the economic impact of the war. https://t.co/byXI8iILQQ https://t.co/wlLyayay3C

The pandemic has hit fragile and conflict-affected countries hard with projected per capita incomes not recovering to 2019 levels until 2024. 

Join our event on Friday, Mar 18 @ 9:00 AM ET on what can be done to support FCS. w/ @KGeorgieva @raj_devex 
https://t.co/dmeVj5sQhP https://t.co/jlkeXlIFzf

In 2021, public debt in fragile and conflict-affected states increased by 17 percentage points to 78% while inflation went up by 9%.

Join us on 3/18 @ 9:00 AM ET w/ @KGeorgieva, @AliH_Allawi, @nskazadi, @WFPChief @raj_devex to learn more
📺 https://t.co/dmeVj5sQhP https://t.co/X5XUdackyp

From Africa to the Caribbean, the Middle East, and Asia, the economic impact of the war in Ukraine is felt globally through surging energy, food, and fertilizer prices, as well as difficult financial conditions and a decline in tourism. Learn more: https://t.co/49F0PgGZfI https://t.co/382GFpDqZI

While oil exporters in the Middle East & North Africa are seeing their fiscal positions improve as a result of higher oil prices, the region as a whole is feeling the impact of the Ukraine crisis quite severely. @KGeorgieva explains what the IMF is doing to help soften the impact https://t.co/ccJGgeGTyj

.@KGeorgieva answering questions from the media on the impact of the war in #Ukraine: In Latin America and the Caribbean region, which is still struggling to recover from the pandemic, we are likely to see pressure on energy prices and high inflation eroding real incomes. https://t.co/mqqVYa89Ob
Wondering what the impact of the war in Ukraine will be on Africa? @KGeorgieva shares 4 possible ways it will impact the region. https://t.co/hwX2aw9Hi7

Today the International Monetary Fund's Executive Board approved $1.4 billion in emergency funding for Ukraine. These funds are for Ukraine to help meet urgent financing needs and mitigate the economic impact of the war. Read more here: https://t.co/r0sG8wh8C3

[4/4] The ongoing war & associated sanctions will have a severe impact on the global economy. We are continuing to assess the evolving situation & provide timely policy advice, financial support, and technical assistance to our members. 
Full statement👇👇
https://t.co/HXuv5qNS2V

[3/4] Countries with close economic links with Ukraine and Russia are at particular risk. #Moldova has requested augmentation and rephasing of its existing IMF program to help with the current crisis. IMF staff are actively discussing options with 🇲🇩authorities.

[2/4] The IMF team on #Ukraine is working hard to fast-track #Ukraine’s request for $1.4 bn emergency financing under the IMF’s Rapid Financing Instrument. Consideration by the Executive Board is likely to happen this coming week.

[1/4] IMF staff briefed the Executive Board yesterday on the economic impact of war in #Ukraine and possible fast-tracked financial assistance for affected countries. In addition to the tragic human toll, the economic damage is already substantial in 🇺🇦.
